text: Preheat oven to 425° Fahrenheit (220° Celsius). Grease a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Boil the spaghetti with the water and salt. Cook until the spaghetti noodles are soft, usually about 7-10 minutes. Drain the spaghetti in a colander and place it in the baking dish.  In a large bowl, whisk the egg, salt, garlic salt, and only a half cup of the mozzarella cheese. Whisk until properly combined. Pour the cheese mixture into the spaghetti. Slowly mix with a wooden spoon. Bake the spaghetti for about fifteen minutes, until the noodles begin to slightly harden and crisp. Remove the spaghetti from the oven. Reduce the heat to 350° Fahrenheit (175° Celsius).  Top the pizza. Spread the pizza with tomato sauce and sprinkle on the basil, oregano, and the remaining cheese. Add the pepperoni. Place the pizza in the oven and have it bake until the cheese bubbles and melts. It should take about thirty minutes. Remove the pizza from the oven. Let it cool a little. Serve. Cut a slice of pizza and place it on a serving plate. Enjoy!
